However, variable reporting rates are confounded with generation time, and shape estimates of R t in the same ways that variation in generation time can [ 33]. For example, a sharp increase in reporting rate will lead to an overestimate of R
t by inflating the numerator relative to the denominator. In the context of field outbreak response, such an increase in reporting might be caused by increased allocation of resources to contact tracing, or an increase in hospital bed capacity.
